qas.question: What percentage of 14 year olds said they were proud to be German in 2009?
What percentage of 14 year olds in 2009 said they would choose German for their nationality if they got to choose?
What war was followed by an increase in national symbols?
What sentiment do 78% of Germans agree with?
Who says Germans are still afraid to be openly proud of their country?

context: For decades after the <b3_0>Second World War,<b3_0/> any national symbol or expression was a taboo. However, the <b4_0>Germans<b4_0/> are becoming increasingly patriotic. During a study in 2009, in which some 2,000 German citizens age 14 and upwards filled out a questionnaire, nearly <a0_0>60<a0_0/>% of those surveyed agreed with the sentiment <b5_0>"I'm proud to be German."<b5_0/> And <a1_0>78<a1_0/>%, if free to choose their nation, would opt for German nationality with "near or absolute certainty". Another study in 2009, carried out by the Identity Foundation in Düsseldorf, showed that 73% of the Germans were proud of their country, twice more than 8 years earlier. According to <b6_0>Eugen Buss,<b6_0/> a sociology professor at the <a2_0>University of Hohenheim<a2_0/>, there's an ongoing normalisation and more and more Germans are becoming openly proud of their country.
